title: Stricter types for `create_derived` in `function_wrapper.py`
body_html:
This is rebased on #4947, please only review the last commit.

function_wrapper.py has two big functions: create_generic and create_derived. create_derived uses only part of the output (rather, input...) of create_generic. This PR gives create_derived a stricter type that is a subset of the output (input) of create_generic and will hopefully help with breaking up the gargantuan FunctionOption into smaller pieces.

cc @ezyang

Test Plan

run mypy type checker

body:
This is rebased on #4947, please only review the last commit.

`function_wrapper.py` has two big functions: `create_generic` and `create_derived`. `create_derived` uses only part of the output (rather, input...) of `create_generic`. This PR gives `create_derived` a stricter type that is a subset of the output (input) of create_generic and will hopefully help with breaking up the gargantuan `FunctionOption` into smaller pieces.

cc @ezyang 

# Test Plan
run mypy type checker
